<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[112, 460, 141, 479]]<|/det|>
<label>(b)</label>

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 460, 680, 479]]<|/det|>
A sequence \(u_{1}, u_{2}, u_{3}, u_{4}, \ldots \ldots \ldots \ldots\) is given by the following rules.

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 494, 680, 512]]<|/det|>
\(u_{1} = 2,\) \(u_{2} = 3\) and \(u_{n} = 2u_{n - 2} + u_{n - 1}\) for \(n \geqslant 3\).

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 528, 680, 546]]<|/det|>
For example, the third term is \(u_{3}\) and \(u_{3} = 2u_{1} + u_{2} = 2\times 2 + 3 = 7.\)

<|ref|>text<|/ref|><|det|>[[149, 543, 470, 561]]<|/det|>
So, the sequence is 2, 3, 7, \(u_{4}, u_{5}, \ldots \ldots\)
